title: Cat. 2  Pine Tree Shilling, 1663/82
publication_title: American Silver in the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">John Hull (American, born England, 1624–1683)  
Robert Sanderson (American, born England, c. 1608–1693)  
Boston, Massachusetts  
Silver; diam. 2.3 cm (7/8 in.)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of Mrs. Francis P. Garvan, 1949.119–20

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section curatorial_entry" id="curatorial_entry">None

Struck on obverse: IN • MASATHVSETS

Struck on reverse: NEW ENGLAND • AN DOM •

Struck in center: 1652/ XII

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">Mrs. Francis P. Garvan, New York, by 1949.

Given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1949.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Art Institute of Chicago, From Colony to Nation: An Exhibition of American Painting, Silver and Architecture from 1650 to the War of 1812, April 21–June 19, 1949, p. 95, cat. 175.

Milwaukee (WI) Art Institute, Tradition of American Silver, February 13–March 9, 1953, cat. 1.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Sweet et al. (1949), p. 95, cat. 175.

Milwaukee Art Institute (1953), cat. 1.

Naeve (1978b), p. 496 (ill.).

</section><section id="figures">Pine Tree Shilling, 1663/82.

</section>
